episodeTitle: Landing! The All-Female Island, Amazon Lily
description: After being sent flying by Bartholomew Kuma, Luffy lands on the mysterious all-female island of Amazon Lily. Searching for food, he eats parasitic mushrooms that grow on his body while he sleeps. He is discovered by Kuja warriors who take him to their village for treatment, where they discover his true gender.

events.title: Luffy Lands on Amazon Lily
events.description: After being sent flying by Bartholomew Kuma's Nikyu Nikyu no Mi powers, Luffy crashes onto an unknown island after traveling for three days inside a paw-shaped bubble. He lands surrounded by the imprint of a giant paw pad, disoriented and searching for his crew.
events.significance: This marks Luffy's arrival at Amazon Lily and the beginning of the Amazon Lily Arc, a crucial turning point where Luffy is separated from his crew and must navigate an all-female warrior society.

quotes.text: Where am I? And where's everyone else?!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first words after landing on Amazon Lily, showing his immediate concern for his scattered crew

events.title: Debut of Amazon Lily Location
events.description: The narrator introduces Amazon Lily, explaining it is an island inhabited by the Kuja tribe of female warriors where men face certain death if they set foot. The island is located in the Calm Belt, protected by Sea Kings.
events.significance: Establishes the rules and danger of Amazon Lily, setting up the central conflict of the arc and introducing one of One Piece's most unique locations.

quotes.text: Amazon Lily - an island inhabited by the Kuja tribe of female warriors, where men face certain death if they set foot.
quotes.speaker: Narrator
quotes.context: Introduction of the island's deadly rule for males

events.title: Luffy Eats the Body Mushrooms
events.description: Hungry and searching for food, Luffy discovers various mushrooms in the forest. He begins eating them, experiencing different emotional effects from each type - some make him laugh uncontrollably, others make him cry. He gorges himself on the mushrooms before collapsing.
events.significance: This comedic moment showcases Luffy's reckless eating habits and sets up the discovery by the Kuja warriors. The mushrooms are later revealed to be parasitic 'Body Mushrooms' that drain the host's life force.

quotes.text: These mushrooms are amazing! Each one makes me feel totally different!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excited reaction while eating the emotion-inducing mushrooms

events.title: Marguerite, Sweet Pea, and Aphelandra Debut
events.description: Three Kuja warriors - Marguerite, Sweet Pea, and Aphelandra - investigate smoke from Luffy's earlier cooking fire. They discover an unconscious person covered head to toe in parasitic mushrooms growing from their body.
events.significance: Introduction of the first Kuja warriors who will play important roles in the Amazon Lily Arc, particularly Marguerite who becomes one of Luffy's first allies on the island.

quotes.text: What is that?! A person covered in mushrooms!
quotes.speaker: Sweet Pea
quotes.context: Sweet Pea's shocked reaction upon finding Luffy

quotes.text: These are 'Mushrooms-Growing-Out-of-Your-Body' Mushrooms! They can suck the life force out of the victim if they remain!
quotes.speaker: Marguerite
quotes.context: Marguerite identifying the dangerous parasitic mushrooms on Luffy

events.title: Luffy Brought to Amazon Lily Village
events.description: The three Kuja warriors carry the unconscious, mushroom-covered Luffy back to their village. The village women gather around, curious about the strange visitor they assume is a girl from another part of their island.
events.significance: Luffy's entry into the heart of Amazon Lily sets up the coming revelation and conflict. The Kuja women's assumption that Luffy is female creates dramatic irony.

events.title: Belladonna Debut and Mushroom Removal
events.description: Belladonna, a medical expert among the Kuja, arrives to treat Luffy. Under her direction, the women pull the mushrooms from Luffy's body and burn the remaining roots. The treatment is painful but necessary to save the mysterious visitor's life.
events.significance: Introduces Belladonna as a competent medical figure and shows the Kuja's willingness to help strangers, establishing their generally good nature despite their isolationist laws.

quotes.text: Pull them out one by one, then burn the stems that remain. We need to remove all traces or they'll grow back.
quotes.speaker: Belladonna
quotes.context: Belladonna's medical instructions for treating the mushroom infection

events.title: The Bath Discovery - Luffy's Gender Revealed
events.description: After removing the mushrooms, the Kuja women notice Luffy has other injuries and decide to bathe him. During the washing, Sweet Pea notices a 'mushroom' between Luffy's legs that won't come off no matter how hard they pull. Elder Nyon (Gloriosa) arrives and immediately realizes the truth - this visitor is male.
events.significance: This is the pivotal moment of the episode where Luffy's gender is discovered, creating the central conflict of the arc. The comedic scene highlights the Kuja women's complete innocence about male anatomy, having never seen a man before.

quotes.text: There's another mushroom here that won't come off!
quotes.speaker: Sweet Pea
quotes.context: Sweet Pea's innocent confusion about Luffy's male anatomy

quotes.text: You fools! That's not a mushroom! This person... is a man!
quotes.speaker: Gloriosa (Elder Nyon)
quotes.context: Gloriosa's shocking revelation of Luffy's true gender

events.title: Elder Nyon (Gloriosa) Debut
events.description: Gloriosa, also known as Elder Nyon, makes her first appearance. As a former empress of Amazon Lily from three generations prior, she is one of the few Kuja who has knowledge of the outside world and men. She immediately recognizes Luffy as male and understands the gravity of the situation.
events.significance: Introduces a key advisor character who will serve as a bridge between the isolated Kuja society and the outside world. Her knowledge and wisdom will be crucial in the coming episodes.

events.title: Kikyo and Nerine Debut
events.description: Additional Kuja warriors including Kikyo and Nerine appear among the crowd gathered to witness the strange visitor. They are present during the shocking revelation of Luffy's gender.
events.significance: Introduces more members of the Kuja tribe who will play roles in the arc, expanding the cast of Amazon Lily inhabitants.

events.title: The Kuja's Reaction to a Male Intruder
events.description: Upon learning that Luffy is male, the Kuja women are shocked and horrified. The episode ends on this cliffhanger as the full implications of a man being on Amazon Lily begin to sink in, setting up the conflict for the next episode.
events.significance: Sets up the main conflict of the Amazon Lily Arc - Luffy must survive on an island where men are forbidden and face execution. This moment drives the tension for upcoming episodes.

themes.description: The episode explores the Kuja tribe's complete isolation from the outside world, particularly from men. Their innocence about basic male anatomy creates both comedy and highlights how isolated societies develop unique worldviews.
themes.symbolism: The all-female island represents a complete separation from the typical pirate world Luffy knows, forcing him into unfamiliar territory.
culturalReferences: References to Amazon warrior legends from Greek mythology

themes.description: This episode emphasizes Luffy's separation from his crew after Kuma scattered them. His repeated concerns about his nakama show how much he values his crew.
themes.symbolism: Luffy landing alone on a remote island mirrors his emotional isolation from those he cares about most.

themes.description: The episode uses the Kuja women's innocence about men for comedic effect, particularly in the bath scene. This creates humor without malice, as the characters are genuinely naive rather than deliberately crude.
themes.symbolism: The 'mushroom' misunderstanding symbolizes the complete cultural gap between the Kuja and the outside world.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy finds himself in completely unfamiliar territory, separated from his crew and landing in a place where his very existence is forbidden. Despite this, his natural resilience and survival instincts are on display.

Searches for food and recklessly eats parasitic mushrooms
Remains unconscious for most of the episode while the Kuja discover his gender

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a kind and knowledgeable Kuja warrior who shows immediate compassion for the mysterious stranger, even before knowing they are male. She demonstrates medical knowledge by identifying the mushrooms.

Helps carry Luffy to the village for treatment

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the mushroom-eating scene, showing Luffy experiencing more varied emotional reactions to different mushrooms than shown in the manga.
The bath scene is slightly extended in the anime with additional reactions from the gathered Kuja women.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time in the series that Luffy is completely alone without any of his crew members present, emphasizing the severity of their separation.
The episode had a TV rating of 10.6% and ranked 4th in viewership for its time slot in Japan.
Animation inconsistencies include Marguerite's sandals disappearing in some frames and Kikyo appearing without lipstick despite having it in earlier scenes.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Chopper and Sanji, members of Luffy's crew who are also separated and scattered to different islands.
Amazon Lily is located in the Calm Belt, one of the most dangerous areas in the One Piece world due to the Sea Kings that inhabit it.

One Piece stopped using ending themes after episode 278, so episode 408 only features the opening theme 'Share the World' by TVXQ. Ending themes would not return until episode 1071, nearly 17 years later.
